input: By the end of this post you’ll be able to build your first AI agent
writing_steps:
Step 1: Purpose and Audience
- Purpose: Educate readers on building their first AI agent
- Audience: AI and data science beginners or those curious about building their first agent

Step 2: Wireframe
[Hook: Direct promise or statement about what will be accomplished]
[Simple stepwise breakdown of how to build a basic AI agent]
[CTA: Invite readers to add their own tools or to share their first project]

Step 3: Body

Building your first AI agent doesn’t have to be complicated. Here’s a simple approach you can use today:

1. Choose your language or stack (Python is common for most beginners)
2. Identify a task you want to automate (e.g., email sorting, summarizing articles)
3. Pick a foundational model (like OpenAI’s GPT or similar API)
4. Write the script to input, process, and output data using the model’s API
5. Set up basic evaluation: run sample inputs and review outputs
6. Refine your prompt and add simple logic to improve reliability

Step 4: CTA
What beginner-friendly AI frameworks or tools have you found most helpful?

Step 5: Hook ideation
A. [User’s own phrasing] “By the end of this post, you’ll be able to build your first AI agent”
B. [Problem/Solution] “Most beginners are confused about where to start with agents. Here’s a direct, 6-step process.”
C. [Beginner-to-expert clarity] “You don’t need a huge team or advanced math to build a useful AI agent.”
D. [How-to] “How to build your first AI agent, even if you’re new to coding.”
E. [Trend/urgency] “AI agents are everywhere. Here’s how to join in.”

Step 6: Choose Hook
[Beginner-to-expert clarity] "You don’t need a huge team or advanced math to build a useful AI agent."

Step 7: Draft the full post

You don’t need a huge team or advanced math to build a useful AI agent.

Here’s a simple way to get started:

1. Pick your programming language (Python is the default for most people)
2. Decide on a task you want to automate (like sorting emails or summarizing blog posts)
3. Get access to a model API (OpenAI’s GPT is a popular choice)
4. Write a basic script to input data, send it to the model, and collect the output
5. Test with sample inputs and review the outputs for quality
6. Iterate by adjusting prompts or adding rules for reliability

Building a basic agent is often easier than people expect once you break it into clear steps.

What beginner-friendly AI tools or frameworks would you recommend?

Step 8: Review and finalize
- One em dash used (none extra)
- No metaphors, business clichés, or motivational language present
- CTA is practical and singular
- Body is actionable and educational
- Voice is clear, direct, and in Shaw’s style
